Home > misc > dist > stk_mindist.m

stk_mindist

PURPOSE

STK_MINDIST computes the separation distance of a set of points

SYNOPSIS

function md = stk_mindist(x)

DESCRIPTION 

 STK_MINDIST computes the separation distance of a set of points

 CALL: D = stk_mindist(X)

    computes the separation distance D of X. More precisely, if X is an
    n x d matrix, then

       D = min_{1 <= i < j <= n} norm(X(i,:) - X(j,:)),

    where norm(.) denotes the Euclidean norm in R^d.

 See also: stk_dist, stk_filldist

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

0041 function md = stk_mindist(x)
0042 
0043 stk_narginchk(1, 1);
0044 
0045 if isstruct(x), x = x.a; end
0046 
0047 % call MEX-file
0048 md = stk_mindist_mex(x);
0049 
0050 end % function stk_mindist
0051 
0052 %%
0053 % Check that ".a" structures are accepted
0054 
0055 %!test
0056 %! d = 3; x = rand(7, d);
0057 %! md1 = stk_mindist(x);
0058 %! md2 = stk_mindist(struct('a', x));
0059 %! assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(md1, md2));
0060 
0061 %%
0062 % Check that sk_mindist(x) is empty when x has zero lines
0063 
0064 %!test
0065 %! for nc = [0 5 10],
0066 %!   x = zeros(0, nc);
0067 %!   d = stk_mindist(x);
0068 %!   assert(isempty(d));
0069 %! end
0070 
0071 %%
0072 % Check that sk_mindist(x) is empty when x has only one line.
0073 
0074 %!test
0075 %! for nc = [0 5 10],
0076 %!   x = rand(1, nc);
0077 %!   d = stk_mindist(x);
0078 %!   assert(isempty(d));
0079 %! end
0080 
0081 %%
0082 % Check that sk_mindist(x) is 0.0 when x has 0 columns (but at least 2 lines)
0083 
0084 %!test
0085 %! for nr = [2 5 10],
0086 %!   x = zeros(nr, 0);
0087 %!   d = stk_mindist(x);
0088 %!   assert(isequal(d, 0.0));
0089 %! end
0090 
0091 %%
0092 % Random matrices with at least 2 lines and 1 column
0093 
0094 %!test
0095 %!
0096 %! nrep = 20;
0097 %! TOL_REL = 1e-15;
0098 %!
0099 %! for irep = 1:nrep,
0100 %!
0101 %!     n = 2 + floor(rand * 10);
0102 %!     d = 1 + floor(rand * 10);
0103 %!     x = rand(n, d);
0104 %!     z = stk_mindist(x);
0105 %!
0106 %!     assert(isequal(size(d), [1, 1]));
0107 %!     assert(~isnan(d));
0108 %!     assert(~isinf(d));
0109 %!
0110 %!     % check the result
0111 %!     mindist = Inf;
0112 %!     for i = 1:(n-1),
0113 %!         for j = (i+1):n,
0114 %!             mindist = min(mindist, norm(x(i,:) - x(j,:)));
0115 %!         end
0116 %!     end
0117 %!     assert(abs(z - mindist) <= TOL_REL * mindist);
0118 %!
0119 %! end
